title: Oscars' epic mistake
text:
Oscars' epic mistake Updated 1022 GMT (1822 HKT) February 27, 2017 
Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as it unfolds. Photos: Oscars' epic mistake The Oscars had a surprise ending that could only happen in Hollywood. Faye Dunaway, left, and Warren Beatty presented the award for best picture Sunday night. Hide Caption 1 of 10 Photos: Oscars' epic mistake However, the envelope they carried was for the previous award, for actress in a leading role. Emma Stone of "La La Land" won that award, and Faye Dunaway mistakenly read   best picture. Hide Caption 2 of 10 Photos: Oscars' epic mistake "La La Land" producer Jordan Horowitz, center, accepts his award for best picture Faye Dunaway (second from right) and Warren Beatty next to producer Fred Berger. Hide Caption 3 of 10 Photos: Oscars' epic mistake Producers of "La La Land" give acceptance speeches before learning that their movie was not the real winner. Hide Caption 4 of 10 Photos: Oscars' epic mistake "La La Land" producer Jordan Horowitz, second from left, speaks to stage manager Gary Natoli, center, who had the envelope that showed "Moonlight" as the best picture. Hide Caption 5 of 10 Photos: Oscars' epic mistake "La La Land" producer Jordan Horowitz, lower left, stops the show to announce the actual best picture winner as "Moonlight." Hide Caption 6 of 10 Photos: Oscars' epic mistake From left, Jordan Horowitz, host Jimmy Kimmel and   confer briefly after the mistake was made known. Hide Caption 7 of 10 Photos: Oscars' epic mistake Jordan Horowitz, producer of "La La Land," shows the correct card that says "Moonlight" won best picture. Hide Caption 8 of 10 Photos: Oscars' epic mistake Host Jimmy Kimmel, right, speaks onstage as the cast and crew of "Moonlight" celebrate winning best picture. Hide Caption
